Re: Were You At Church Yesterday?.Subject: Re: Were You At Church Yesterday?
Re: Were You At Church Yesterday?.Body:
Wow.  I did not know you are a Boy Scout!  Praise God!

Thank you for the update, Evan!  

In Christ,
Rich

> On Feb 27, 2017, at 5:48 PM, Evan Tan <evant5252@yahoo.com> wrote:
> 
> No, I went camping for boy scouts.
> Sent from Yahoo Mail on Android <https://overview.mail.yahoo.com/mobile/?.src=Android>
> On Mon, Feb 27, 2017 at 12:49 PM, Rich Katekawa
> <elijahkat@gmail.com> wrote:
> Dear Evan:
> 
> Were you at church yesterday?  Were you in Youth Group?
> 
> Please forgive your pastor’s memory!  It is fading as it gets older!
> 
> In Christ,
> Rich

Re: English Worship.Subject: Re: English Worship
Re: English Worship.Body:
Dear Josh:

Thank you for letting us know!

I am praying for God to bless and protect you as you travel to North Carolina.

See you next Sunday!

In Christ,
Rich

> On Apr 21, 2017, at 1:14 PM, Josh Poli <jwhpoli@msn.com> wrote:
> 
> Hello Pastor Rich,
> 
> I won't be coming to church on Sunday as I will be on business trip to North Carolina and will be back on Wednesday
> 
> Thanks,
> Josh
> 
> 
> From: Rich Katekawa <elijahkat@gmail.com>
> Sent: Friday, April 7, 2017 6:13 PM
> To: Peter Wongka; Josh & Hanny Poli; Dan Chan; Nico Kutadinata; Patricia Kutadinata; James & Swan Lim; Adrian Alan Sehoko
> Cc: Jing Borro; Kelvin Koe; Evan Tan; stephanustangke1998@gmail.com
> Subject: English Worship
>  
> Dear English Worship Team:
> 
> I thank God for the honor and privilege of serving the Lord with you!
> 
> Here is our program for this Sunday:
> 
> Call to Worship:  1 Peter 1:13-15
> 
> Praise in Song:  12 Praise Him! Praise Him! (1-2)
> 
> Intercessory Prayer
> 
> Praise in Song:  12 Praise Him! Praise Him! (3)
> 
> Scripture Reading:  1 Samuel 15:22-23
> 
> Preparatory Hymn:  597 Take My Life and Let It Be Consecrated (1-3)
> 
> Sermon:  Are You a Pagan or Are You a Christian?
> 
> Offertory Hymn:  597 Take My Life and Let It Be Consecrated (4-6)
> 
> Ministry News: 
> 
> Prayer Meeting This Wednesday, April 12, at 7:30 PM.
> 
> Combined Indonesian/English Good Friday Service, April 14, at 7:30 PM.  Pastor Rich will preach and Pastor Peter will translate.  Communion will be served.
> 
> 2017 NLBC Sunday School Easter Picnic Fellowship, Saturday, April 15, 11:30 AM - 4 PM, at Craig Regional Park, 3300 State College Blvd., Fullerton, CA 92835.  Please sign up for Potluck Sheet in the Sunday School Room!  All families with kids are invited.  Contact Nicole Gandasutisna (626 617-0400) or Ivena Chan (626 675-9528) for more info!
> 
> Combined Indonesian/English Easter Service, April 16.  Ev. Michael Teng will preach and Pastor Peter will translate.

Re: English Worship.Subject: Re: English Worship
Re: English Worship.Body:
Dear Josh:

Pastor Peter just called me to make sure I make the Missions Sunday announcement.  We have already printed and copied our bulletins for tomorrow.  So I will make the Missions Sunday announcement orally tomorrow.

In Christ,
Rich

> On May 13, 2017, at 9:32 PM, Josh Poli <jwhpoli@msn.com> wrote:
> 
> Pastor Rich,
> On the ministry news, please add that Mission Sunday will be on 5/21 and there will be a short presentation on mission projects funded by NLBC by Dr. Herman. We will have 2 offerings, regular and offering for Mission Sunday
> Thanks
> Josh
> 
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Rich Katekawa [mailto:elijahkat@gmail.com] 
> Sent: Friday, May 12, 2017 11:06 AM
> To: Peter Wongka <peterwongka@yahoo.com>; Josh & Hanny Poli <jwhpoli@msn.com>; Dan Chan <dannil.chan@gmail.com>; Nico Kutadinata <nico.jonathan@gmail.com>; Patricia Kutadinata <patrishoei@yahoo.com>; James & Swan Lim <jamesk.lim@att.net>; Adrian Alan Sehoko <asehoko@gmail.com>
> Cc: Kelvin Koe <Kelvkoe2@gmail.com>; Evan Tan <evant5252@yahoo.com>; stephanustangke1998@gmail.com
> Subject: English Worship
> 
> Dear English Worship Team:
> 
> May God grow us deeper and wider:  deeper in the grace and knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ, and wider in our influence to others.  Amen.
> 
> Here is our Liturgy for this coming Sunday. I will send the Sermon Notes ASAP.
> 
> Call to Worship:   Psalm 145:1-2
> 
> Praise in Song:  56 To God Be the Glory (1-2)
> 
> Intercessory Prayer
> 
> Praise in Song:  56 To God Be the Glory (3)
> 
> Scripture Reading:  1 Peter 3:1-7
> 
> Preparatory Hymn:  793 For The Beauty of the Earth (1-3)
> 
> Sermon:  A Woman of Noble Character, Who Can Find? She is More Valuable Than Rubies
> 
> Offertory Hymn:  100 Thou Art Worthy (x3)
> 
> Ministry News: 
> 
> Happy Mother’s Day!  May God bless all our Moms this blessed Sunday!  Amen.
> 
> No Prayer Meeting This Wednesday.
> 
> NLBC Fellowship This Saturday, May 20, 7 PM.  We will resume our study of “Gods At War”, led by Ev. Michael Teng.

Re: Revised ENGLISH SERVICE SCHEDULE: OC.Subject: Re: Revised ENGLISH SERVICE SCHEDULE: OCT - DEC

In Christ,
Rich

> Good morning, everyone!
> My apologies, I did not include Sandy Ong in this thread. We also thank him for helping us this week as liturgist!

> Patricia
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Good evening, everyone, 
> 
> Please see the attached updates! We want to welcome and thank Peter Chandra and Felicia Lim for their help with our English Service in the next few months!
> 
> Again, please let me know as soon as possible if there are any scheduling conflicts. 
> 
> The following changes now appear on the schedule:
> 
> October 22
> Liturgist: Sandy Ong
> Powerpoint: Stephanus Tangke
> 
> November 12
> Pianist: Peter Chandra

> November 19
> Pianist: Felicia Lim

> Pianist: Peter Chandra
> 
> 
> Thanks!
> Patricia
> <ENGLISH SERVICE 2017 OCT - DEC REV1.pdf>

Re: ENGLISH SERVICE SCHEDULE: JAN - MAR.Subject: Re: ENGLISH SERVICE SCHEDULE: JAN - MAR 2018
Re: ENGLISH SERVICE SCHEDULE: JAN - MAR.Body:
Welcome back home, Joanne!

We have been praying for your safe return.  We missed you very much!

In Christ,
Rich

> On Jan 10, 2018, at 10:51 PM, Joanne Phung <jhphung5@gmail.com> wrote:
> 
> Hi everyone, 
> 
> A bit late, but Happy New Year everyone! I'm back in the US from a trip to Indonesia and Taiwan!
> 
> Thank you for the new schedule Patricia, I put the dates on my calendar. 
> 
> Thank you, 
> 
> Joanne Phung 
> 
> 
> On Dec 10, 2017 1:04 AM, "Patricia Oei" <patrishoei@gmail.com <mailto:patrishoei@gmail.com>> wrote:
> Good evening, everyone!
> 
> Happy New Year! (almost!) Thank you all for your faithfulness in being a part of our English Service ministry. Please see the attached schedule for the coming new year, for the months of JAN through MAR.
> 
> If there are any scheduling conflicts or concerns, do not hesitate to contact me as soon as possible. Have a wonderful Christmas and New Year!
> 
> In Christ,
> Patricia
> 
> 
>

Re: English Ministry Workers Meeting - F.Subject: Re: English Ministry Workers Meeting - Feb 25th at 1:15pm
Re: English Ministry Workers Meeting - F.Body:
Sounds good. I will be there!  

In Christ,
Rich 

Sent from my iPhone

> On Feb 7, 2018, at 7:03 PM, Dan Chan <dannil.chan@gmail.com> wrote:
> 
> Hello everyone,
> 
> I would like to have an English ministry workers meeting on Sunday, Feb 25 right after lunch to discuss details on our responsibilities and feedbacks/comments on how to make our Sunday morning English service smoother.  We can also discuss any concerns/feedbacks you might have regarding your tasks. 
>

> 
> - Dan

Re: Youth Retreat.Subject: Re: Youth Retreat
Re: Youth Retreat.Body:
Dear Evan:

Yes, we have WiFi at the Retreat.  Stephanie will allow you to use her computer to Skype your Boy Scout Troop.  But we are not allowing the other students to use their electronics except for emergency.

In Christ, 
Rich


> On Jun 27, 2018, at 1:20 AM, Evan Tan <evant5252@gmail.com> wrote:
> 
> Hello Pastor Rich,
> 
>      This is Evan and I'm just asking if I can Skype some people during the retreat at 1:30 on Saturday, which might take up to an hour and a half. The people I'll be Skyping are leaders from my club. I was supposed to attend a meeting that Saturday, but the retreat also occurred on the same week so I had to tell them I couldn't attend. However, they asked if I could Skype them, so could I talk to them or are we busy during that time? Also, do you know if reception is available there?
> 
>           Thanks,
>                Evan

Re: English Ministry Appreciation.Subject: Re: English Ministry Appreciation
Re: English Ministry Appreciation.Body:
Dear Inez:

All the dates are good for me for the Appreciation Luncheon.

In Christ,
Rich

> On Dec 15, 2019, at 4:38 PM, Inez Koe <inezkoe@gmail.com> wrote:
> 
> Dear English Ministry Workers,

>

> December 29
> January 5
> January 12
> 
> Thanks again!
> 
> Regards,

Re: Youth Group Sleepover Reminders.Subject: Re: Youth Group Sleepover Reminders
Re: Youth Group Sleepover Reminders.Body:
Dear Kelly:

What are our Carpool Assignments?

In Christ,
Rich

Sent from my iPhone

> On Feb 13, 2020, at 5:48 PM, Kelly Koe <kellykoekk@gmail.com> wrote:
> 
> ﻿
> Hello all, 
> 
> Thank you for joining us for our last youth group event! There are a few reminders that should be taken into consideration while preparing for the event—like the things you will need to bring and the planned agenda. 
> 
> Please make sure to have: 
> - $50 for Knott's 
> - $20 for breakfast and dinner at the Sarosa's 
> - Sleeping bag 
> - Toiletries 
> - Bible (electronic is fine) 
> Note: Please use cash for payments in order to simplify transactions. 
> 
> Itinerary: 
> Sunday, 02/17 
> - 2:00 PM - Leave to the Sarosa home 
> - 3:00 PM - Estimated arrival. Unpack and unwind 
> - 5:30 PM - Dinner prep and dinner 
> - 8:00 PM - Small group discussion and small praise session 
> - 9:00 PM - Free time 
> - 11:00 PM - Lights out 
> Monday, 02/18 
> - 8:00 AM - Breakfast 
> - 10:00 AM - Leave to Knott's. Make sure you have all your belongings! 
> - 11:00 AM - Estimated arrival 
> - 6:00 PM - Leave Knott's for dinner at Mrs. Knott's Chicken Dinner. Parents are welcome to pick up their youth during/after this time. 
> 
> Please let me know if you have any food or animal allergies, and let me know if you have any questions. 
> 
> Thank you for your time. 
> 
> Kelly

Re: Recipients of White Elephant List 20.Subject: Re: Recipients of White Elephant List 2020 Youth
Re: Recipients of White Elephant List 20.Body:
Dear Brothers and Sisters:

Tomorrow I am planning to drop off Communion Supplies to Abigail and her family.  Who has the Samsonite thing that Abigail won?  I might be able to pick it up and drop it off tomorrow if it is in route.  Please let me know!

In Christ,
Rich

> On Dec 27, 2020, at 8:06 PM, Stephanie Halim <stephanie.halim5@gmail.com> wrote:

> Good Evening Everyone,
> 
> Thanks for playing and being there today! You are all great sports. Pastor Rich and I are always in awe by your dedication to coming to church during these times. We want to let you know how much each and every one of you mean to us. We pray for you to be filled with love, peace and joy in all that you do wherever you are.
> 
> Here is the list below: If there are any questions please don't hesitate to ask me. Please send out your gift by mail, driving over, or by email if it works for you and the person receiving. Talk to each other and try to figure the best possible solution.

NLBC English Ministry for Sunday, June 6.Subject:
NLBC English Ministry for Sunday, June 6 **IMPORTANT UPDATES - PLEASE
 READ**
NLBC English Ministry for Sunday, June 6.Body:
**IMPORTANT UPDATES - PLEASE READ**

Hello, Friends! 

Sunday, June 6, 2021
Speaker: Pastor Rich Katekawa
Message: The Four G's of Peacemaking

- Join us tomorrow morning for in-person English Worship and Communion at 11am! Online services will also be made available at that time. 

- The Pranoto Family Farewell Celebration will follow after both services in the NLBC Sanctuary. 

- NLBC Sunday School Children’s classes will resume tomorrow morning at 11am.

- Beginning July, online services will only consist of a prerecorded Sermon. We encourage all members who are comfortable to meet in-person to join our services at NLBC. 

**All mask-wearing and social distancing protocols will be in place. Please do not attend if you are having any COVID-19 related symptoms or been in contact with someone diagnosed with COVID-19. **

Offering received from 5/22/2021 - 5/28/2021:

Eng & Ind: $3,151.35
Sunday school: $40.00.
Total: $3,191.35

We appreciate your continued support through giving!
For those who would like to send your offering, please see the following options:

1. CASH. Please set aside weekly what you would like to give in an envelope and bring it to NLBC when normal services resume.

2. CHECK. Please mail your check to NLBC, address below:  
3718 Baldwin Park Blvd
Baldwin Park, CA 91706

3. TRANSFER. Please utilize Zelle and send it to nlbcla@outlook.com.

Tune into our NLBC YouTube Channel! Please share the link below with any seniors, parents, and friends who would also like to join us.

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCEYsARi94L_ZuAVcz9yrcUA

Join us for our weekly small group!

*English Youth Group Meeting:  Sunday @2PM *
Zoom Meeting ID: 452 153 2740
Password: nlbc91706

*English Women’s Group Meeting:  Sunday @3PM *
Zoom Meeting ID: 452 153 2740
Password: nlbc91706

Please check with your Group Leaders for any updates. Thank you and God bless!

REVISED NLBC English Ministry for July 1.Subject: REVISED NLBC English Ministry for July 17, 2022
REVISED NLBC English Ministry for July 1.Body:
Hello, Friends! 

Sunday, July 17, 2022
Speaker: Pastor Rich Katekawa
The Rich Ruler and Jesus:  What Must I Do to Inherit Eternal Life? - Luke 18:18-30

- We hope to see you tomorrow for our Worship Service!

- Union Rescue Mission Volunteer Sign-Up is now closed. If you are still interested, please contact Patricia for possible last minute cancellations. 

- Church Security Workshop is Sunday, July 31, after Lunch.  We Are Recruiting Adult Members to Start a Security Ministry.  Contact Me If You Are Interested.

**All mask-wearing and social distancing protocols will still be in place. Please do not attend if you are having any COVID-19 related symptoms or been in contact with someone diagnosed with COVID-19. **
 
Offering from 7/9/2022 - 7/15/2022:

English & Indonesian:  $4,728.65
SS: $78.00
Mission: $2,481.60
Total: $7,288.25

We appreciate your continued support through giving!

For those who would like to send your offering, please see the following options:

1. CASH. Please set aside weekly what you would like to give in an envelope and bring it to NLBC when normal services resume.

2. CHECK. Please mail your check to NLBC, address below:  
3718 Baldwin Park Blvd
Baldwin Park, CA 91706

3. TRANSFER. Please utilize Zelle and send it to nlbcla@outlook.com <mailto:nlbcla@outlook.com>.

Tune into our NLBC YouTube Channel! Please share the link below with any seniors, parents, and friends who would also like to join us.

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCEYsARi94L_ZuAVcz9yrcUA <https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCEYsARi94L_ZuAVcz9yrcUA>

Join us for our weekly small groups!

*Youth Group Is Today in the Chapel at Lunchtime.  Get Your Lunch and Come Back!  College Students Are Welcome to Join Us.

*English Women’s Group Meeting:  Wednesday @ 7:30 PM*
Meeting ID: 8406244255
Passcode: Spring

*Wednesday Night Prayer Meeting:  Wednesday @ 7:30 PM*
Zoom Meeting ID: 302-048-9713
Password: 91706

*College Group is Thursday @ 7:30 PM
Zoom Meeting ID: 452 153 2740
Password: nlbc91706

Please check with your Group Leaders for any updates. Thank you and God bless!

For more information about our sermon or New Life Baptist Church, please reach out to us!
Website: www.nlbcla.org <http://www.nlbcla.org/>
Email: nlbcla_english@outlook.com <mailto:nlbcla_english@outlook.com>

REVISED NLBC English Ministry for Septem.Subject: REVISED NLBC English Ministry for September 11, 2022
REVISED NLBC English Ministry for Septem.Body:
Happy Saturday, Friends! 

Sunday, September 11, 2022
Speaker: Pastor Rich Katekawa
Jacob’s Journey and God’s Faithfulness Every Step of the Way - Genesis 28:10-22

- Join us tomorrow as we celebrate NLBC at 37 years! We will have our regular service and proceed to sanctuary for a combined fellowship with Choir and SS presentations. Hope to see you there!

- Please remain in the sanctuary following the service for a quick round of Kahoot! in honor of our church birthday : )

- The Youth Group Hike Is This Saturday, September 17 at 7 AM, at Oak Canyon Nature Park in Anaheim.  Parents Must Sign Release of Liability Forms by Today!   See Pastor Rich for More Details.

- In Compliance with AB506, the Youth Group Is Recruiting a Teacher to Assist Pastor Rich in Teaching and Leading the Group.  Please Contact Pastor Rich If You Are Interested.

**All mask-wearing and social distancing protocols will still be in place. Please do not attend if you are having any COVID-19 related symptoms or been in contact with someone diagnosed with COVID-19. **

REVISED NLBC English Ministry for August.Subject: REVISED NLBC English Ministry for August 27, 2023
REVISED NLBC English Ministry for August.Body:
￼

Good Afternoon, Brothers and Sisters!  

Sunday, August 27, 2023

Speaker: Pastor Rich Katekawa
Text:  Joshua 2:1-24
Title:  The Life-Risking Faith of Rahab the Prostitute

Theme:  We will study the character of Rahab, her conversion from idols to Yahweh the God of Israel, her lie to the king of Jericho and her protection of the Israelite spies, and her argent intercession for her family.  We will see how God’s grace is magnified in the salvation of a pagan prostitute, who eventually becomes one of the ancestors of our Lord Jesus Christ. 

Our Opening Hymn is 93 God, Our Father, We Adore Thee, Preparatory Hymn is 718 Day by Day, and Offertory Hymn is 111 Glory to the Lamb. 

English Ministry News

- Congratulations to Ian Witarsa for his public profession of faith in Christ through baptism last weekend.  Please continue to pray for God to heal him, and to give strength to him and his family.  Here is the link to his Baptism Video.  It is unlisted and intended only for the NLBC Church Family:  https://youtu.be/LjkvJWDh69Y

- We are preparing a special tribute video to honor Pastor Peter and Shemu for their 40 years of ministry here at NLBC.  We are asking if you would like to share a brief testimony on how you first met Pastor Peter and/or Shemu.  Please let me know if you are interested.  

- Catechism Class: If you are ready to make your public profession of faith in Christ, then please let me know.  We are preparing to teach our Catechism Class for Baptism in our Christmas Service.

- Our English Ministry is recruiting ushers and liturgists.  If you are interested, please contact Pastor Rich or Inez.  Thank you!

Offering Report for 8/19/2023-8/25/2023

English & Indonesian: $2,639.04
SS: $74.00
Mission: $1,628.97
Total: $4,342.01

Attendance Report Last Sunday

English Ministry:  17
Indonesian Ministry:  40

REVISED NLBC English Ministry for Octobe.Subject: REVISED NLBC English Ministry for October 8, 2023
REVISED NLBC English Ministry for Octobe.Body:
Good Afternoon, Brothers and Sisters!  

Sunday, October 8, 2023

Speaker: Pastor Rich Katekawa
Text:  Joshua 5:13-6:27
Title:  Joshua:  A Soldier for the LORD

Theme:  We will examine Joshua as a prime example of humility before God.  Joshua humbles himself before the Commander of the LORD’s Army, takes his orders from the LORD, repeats those orders to the priests and the soldiers, implements the battle plan, and devotes the Canaanite city of Jericho to destruction as his act of worship to the LORD.  Joshua demonstrates his humility before God by his obedience to God’s commands.  And in response, the LORD exalts Joshua.  May our lives demonstrate that same humility and obedience to the Lord.  And may He be pleased to lift us up as well in due time

Opening Hymn:  705 It Is Well with My Soul (1-4)

Preparatory Hymn:  731 Onward, Christian Soldiers (1-4)

Offertory Song:  708 Behold What Manner of Love (x2)

English Ministry News

- NLBC Harvest Festival is Sunday, October 29, at 4 PM @ Church.  Invite your friends and family!  All are welcome.  Contact Ivena for more info.

REVISED NLBC English Ministry for Decemb.Subject: REVISED NLBC English Ministry for December 31, 2023
REVISED NLBC English Ministry for Decemb.Body:
Good Evening, Brothers and Sisters!  

Sunday, December 31, 2023

Speaker:  Pastor Rich Katekawa
Text:  James 5:19-20
Title:  Never Give Up on Those Who Stray Away

Theme:  I was unable due to time constraints to preach these final two verses from the Book of James, and to my delight, God saved these for the final sermon for the English Ministry in 2023.  Our God is the great Shepherd, and we are His sheep.  When we stray away from the fold, He seeks for His lost sheep, and when He finds us, He carries us back into the fold.  Part of our pastoral duty is look for the strays, turn them around, and rescue them.  So never give us on those who stray away.  Jesus Christ is mighty to save!

Opening Hymn:  139 Great Is Thy Faithfulness (1-3)

Preparatory Song:  11 Come Thou Fount of Every Blessing (1-3)

Offertory Hymn:  173 I'm Forever Grateful (x2)

English Ministry News

- Year End Zoom Fellowship is Sunday 8-10 PM.  Our speaker is Pastor Galio.  Our program includes Video Highlights of 2023, a Reflection by Pastor Galio, Testimonies, Prayers, and a Kahoot Game on Christmas.  Please join us!  Zoom ID 302 048 9713
Pwd: 91706

- If any of you would like to share a short testimony of God’s grace to you and your family this past year, please let me know.  We would love for you to share.  Thank you!

REVISED NLBC English Ministry for Januar.Body:
Good Evening, Brothers and Sisters!  

Sunday, January 14, 2023

Speaker:  Pastor Rich Katekawa
Text:  Psalm 33:1-22
Title:  The LORD Is the Creator King Who Rules the World by His Word

Theme: From this wonderful ancient hymn we will learn six ways the honor the Creator King of the Universe:  worship Him (vv. 1-3), obey Him (vv. 4-9), submit to Him (vv. 10-12), fear Him (vv. 13-15), trust Him (vv. 16-19), and wait on Him (vv. 20-22).

Opening Hymn:  3 Holy, Holy, Holy! Lord God Almighty (1-4)

Preparatory Hymn:  100 Thou Art Worthy (x2)

Offertory Hymn:  576 The Steadfast Love of the Lord (x2)

English Ministry News
